channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Unbiased Multi-Modality Guidance for Image Inpainting
item.description: Image inpainting is an ill-posed problem to recover missing or damaged image content based on incomplete images with masks.

item.title: Learning to Construct 3D Building Wireframes from 3D Line Clouds
item.description: Line clouds, though under-investigated in the previous work, potentially encode more compact structural information of buildings than point clouds extracted from multi-view images.

item.title: Time Series Clustering with an EM algorithm for Mixtures of Linear Gaussian State Space Models
item.description: To address this problem, we propose a novel model-based time series clustering method with mixtures of linear Gaussian state space models, which have high flexibility.

item.title: Refine and Represent: Region-to-Object Representation Learning
item.description: Recent works in self-supervised learning have demonstrated strong performance on scene-level dense prediction tasks by pretraining with object-centric or region-based correspondence objectives.

item.title: Interpretable Multimodal Emotion Recognition using Hybrid Fusion of Speech and Image Data
item.description: A new interpretability technique has been developed to identify the important speech & image features leading to the prediction of particular emotion classes.

item.title: An Empirical Analysis of the Efficacy of Different Sampling Techniques for Imbalanced Classification
item.description: There are numerous approaches to dealing with imbalanced data, but the efficacy of such techniques or an experimental comparison among those techniques has not been conducted.

item.title: Skeleton Prototype Contrastive Learning with Multi-Level Graph Relation Modeling for Unsupervised Person Re-Identification
item.description: Lastly, we propose a skeleton prototype contrastive learning scheme that clusters feature-correlative instances of unlabeled graph representations and contrasts their inherent similarity with representative skeleton features ("skeleton prototypes") to learn discriminative skeleton representations for person re-ID.

item.title: Learning Relational Causal Models with Cycles through Relational Acyclification
item.description: We introduce \textit{relational acyclification}, an operation specifically designed for relational models that enables reasoning about the identifiability of cyclic relational causal models.

item.title: Efficient Truncated Linear Regression with Unknown Noise Variance
item.description: In this paper, we provide the first computationally and statistically efficient estimators for truncated linear regression when the noise variance is unknown, estimating both the linear model and the variance of the noise.

item.title: Identity-Sensitive Knowledge Propagation for Cloth-Changing Person Re-identification
item.description: To mitigate the resolution degradation issue and mine identity-sensitive cues from human faces, we propose to restore the missing facial details using prior facial knowledge, which is then propagated to a smaller network.

item.title: A deep learning approach to predict the number of k-barriers for intrusion detection over a circular region using wireless sensor networks
item.description: One of the crucial applications of WSNs is intrusion detection and surveillance at the border areas and in the defense establishments.

item.title: Deep Learning-based approaches for automatic detection of shell nouns and evaluation on WikiText-2
item.description: All discovered shell nouns as well as pre-trained models and code are available on GitHub.

item.title: JAXFit: Trust Region Method for Nonlinear Least-Squares Curve Fitting on the GPU
item.description: We implement a trust region method on the GPU for nonlinear least squares curve fitting problems using a new deep learning Python library called JAX.

item.title: A Comparison of Reinforcement Learning Frameworks for Software Testing Tasks
item.description: In this paper, we empirically investigate the applications of carefully selected RL algorithms on two important software testing tasks: test case prioritization in the context of Continuous Integration (CI) and game testing.

item.title: Supervised Contrastive Learning for Affect Modelling
item.description: Affect modeling is viewed, traditionally, as the process of mapping measurable affect manifestations from multiple modalities of user input to affect labels.

item.title: The ReprGesture entry to the GENEA Challenge 2022
item.description: This paper describes the ReprGesture entry to the Generation and Evaluation of Non-verbal Behaviour for Embodied Agents (GENEA) challenge 2022.

item.title: Pix4Point: Image Pretrained Transformers for 3D Point Cloud Understanding
item.description: In the realm of 3D point clouds, the availability of large datasets is a challenge, which exacerbates the issue of training Transformers for 3D tasks.

item.title: Supervised Dimensionality Reduction and Classification with Convolutional Autoencoders
item.description: It turned out that this methodology can also be greatly beneficial in enforcing explainability of deep learning architectures.

item.title: Contrastive Audio-Language Learning for Music
item.description: In this work, we explore cross-modal learning in an attempt to bridge audio and language in the music domain.

item.title: Polarimetric Inverse Rendering for Transparent Shapes Reconstruction
item.description: We build a polarization dataset for multi-view transparent shapes reconstruction to verify our method.

item.title: Data-driven Predictive Tracking Control based on Koopman Operators
item.description: We seek to combine the nonlinear modeling capabilities of a wide class of neural networks with the safety guarantees of model predictive control (MPC) in a rigorous and online computationally tractable framework.

item.title: Masked Autoencoders Enable Efficient Knowledge Distillers
item.description: For example, by distilling the knowledge from an MAE pre-trained ViT-L into a ViT-B, our method achieves 84. 0% ImageNet top-1 accuracy, outperforming the baseline of directly distilling a fine-tuned ViT-L by 1. 2%.

item.title: Adaptive Perception Transformer for Temporal Action Localization
item.description: Besides, their multi-stage designs cannot generate action boundaries and categories straightforwardly.

item.title: Towards an Awareness of Time Series Anomaly Detection Models' Adversarial Vulnerability
item.description: To the best of our understanding, we demonstrate, for the first time, the vulnerabilities of anomaly detection systems against adversarial attacks.

item.title: GAN-based generative modelling for dermatological applications -- comparative study
item.description: The lack of sufficiently large open medical databases is one of the biggest challenges in AI-powered healthcare.

item.title: A Deep Learning Approach Using Masked Image Modeling for Reconstruction of Undersampled K-spaces
item.description: The model was evaluated through L1 loss, gradient normalization, and structural similarity values.

item.title: Fast Nearest Convolution for Real-Time Efficient Image Super-Resolution
item.description: The proposed nearest convolution has the same performance as the nearest upsampling but is much faster and more suitable for Android NNAPI.

item.title: DCSF: Deep Convolutional Set Functions for Classification of Asynchronous Time Series
item.description: Because of the asynchronous nature, they pose a significant challenge to deep learning architectures, which presume that the time series presented to them are regularly sampled, fully observed, and aligned with respect to time.

item.title: Q-Net: Query-Informed Few-Shot Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Deep learning has achieved tremendous success in computer vision, while medical image segmentation (MIS) remains a challenge, due to the scarcity of data annotations.

item.title: On the Design of Privacy-Aware Cameras: a Study on Deep Neural Networks
item.description: At the same time, we ensure that useful non-sensitive data can still be extracted from distorted images.

item.title: Sliding Window Recurrent Network for Efficient Video Super-Resolution
item.description: Different from single image super-resolution, VSR can utilize frames' temporal information to reconstruct results with more details.

item.title: RZSR: Reference-based Zero-Shot Super-Resolution with Depth Guided Self-Exemplars
item.description: To advance ZSSR, we obtain reference image patches with rich textures and high-frequency details which are also extracted only from the input image using cross-scale matching.

item.title: A Bayesian Variational principle for dynamic Self Organizing Maps
item.description: We propose organisation conditions that yield a method for training SOM with adaptative neighborhood radius in a variational Bayesian framework.

item.title: Tracking by weakly-supervised learning and graph optimization for whole-embryo C. elegans lineages
item.description: Our work specifically addresses the following challenging properties of C. elegans embryo recordings: (1) Many cell divisions as compared to benchmark recordings of other organisms, and (2) the presence of polar bodies that are easily mistaken as cell nuclei.

item.title: Self-Filtering: A Noise-Aware Sample Selection for Label Noise with Confidence Penalization
item.description: Sample selection is an effective strategy to mitigate the effect of label noise in robust learning.

item.title: A novel approach for Fair Principal Component Analysis based on eigendecomposition
item.description: Principal component analysis (PCA), a ubiquitous dimensionality reduction technique in signal processing, searches for a projection matrix that minimizes the mean squared error between the reduced dataset and the original one.

item.title: Applying Eigencontours to PolarMask-Based Instance Segmentation
item.description: Eigencontours are the first data-driven contour descriptors based on singular value decomposition.

item.title: Unrestricted Black-box Adversarial Attack Using GAN with Limited Queries
item.description: First, we demonstrate that our targeted attack method is query-efficient to produce unrestricted adversarial examples for a facial identity recognition model that contains 307 identities.

item.title: Deep Hyperspectral and Multispectral Image Fusion with Inter-image Variability
item.description: The fusion problem is stated as an optimization problem in the maximum a posteriori framework.

item.title: Secondary Protein Structure Prediction Using Neural Networks
item.description: Secondly, we test the impact of varying the length of protein sequence we input into the model.

item.title: Addressing Token Uniformity in Transformers via Singular Value Transformation
item.description: In this paper, we propose to use the distribution of singular values of outputs of each transformer layer to characterise the phenomenon of token uniformity and empirically illustrate that a less skewed singular value distribution can alleviate the `token uniformity' problem.

item.title: Symbolic Replay: Scene Graph as Prompt for Continual Learning on VQA Task
item.description: However, CL on VQA involves not only the expansion of label sets (new Answer sets).

item.title: EEG4Students: An Experimental Design for EEG Data Collection and Machine Learning Analysis
item.description: However, during the COVID-19 pandemic, data collection and analysis could be more challenging.

item.title: Combining phylogeny and coevolution improves the inference of interaction partners among paralogous proteins
item.description: We show that these two signals can be combined to improve the performance of the inference of interaction partners among paralogs.

item.title: DPTDR: Deep Prompt Tuning for Dense Passage Retrieval
item.description: We believe this work facilitates the industry, as it saves enormous efforts and costs of deployment and increases the utility of computing resources.

item.title: YOLOPv2: Better, Faster, Stronger for Panoptic Driving Perception
item.description: Over the last decade, multi-tasking learning approaches have achieved promising results in solving panoptic driving perception problems, providing both high-precision and high-efficiency performance.

item.title: Of Human Criteria and Automatic Metrics: A Benchmark of the Evaluation of Story Generation
item.description: However, there is no consensus on which human evaluation criteria to use, and no analysis of how well automatic criteria correlate with them.

item.title: PeRFception: Perception using Radiance Fields
item.description: The recent progress in implicit 3D representation, i. e., Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), has made accurate and photorealistic 3D reconstruction possible in a differentiable manner.

item.title: Self-Supervised Endoscopic Image Key-Points Matching
item.description: Feature matching and finding correspondences between endoscopic images is a key step in many clinical applications such as patient follow-up and generation of panoramic image from clinical sequences for fast anomalies localization.

item.title: Maximum Likelihood on the Joint (Data, Condition) Distribution for Solving Ill-Posed Problems with Conditional Flow Models
item.description: The utility of this trick is limited for non-conditional models, but an extension of the approach, applied to maximum likelihood of the joint probability distribution of data and conditioning information, can be used to train sophisticated \textit{conditional} flow models.
